link.title: West Boulevard Elementary - News

form.name: aspnetForm

span.p: Governor DeWine has ordered the continued closure of K-12 schools through May 1st. We will continue remote learning as an option. The scheduled spring break (April 10-19) will be observed. There will be no new instruction during break. Remote learning will resume April 20.

img.alt: Safety Village 2019-20

div.a: Message From Superintendent Saxton: April 17

img.alt: new update graphic

p.span: The purpose of this message is to remind all school families that distance learning and online instruction will resume on Monday, April 20th. Individual details about online instruction and paper packets will be communicated to families from their building principal or child's teacher.

a.title: Click to read more about: Message From Superintendent Saxton: April 17

div.a: Read More about Message From Superintendent Saxton: April 17
NEXT MEAL DISTRIBUTION: MONDAY, APRIL 20 [11am-2pm]

img.alt: MEAL DISTRIBUTION AT BHS WITH RYAN STACKING TABLES

span.p: All children, regardless of income, from the ages of 1-18 are eligible for meals: 5 breakfasts and 5 lunches for the week. Children should be present. A drive-thru type of pickup from Doors 8 & 9 (North).

span.span: will be the next Scheduled Meal Distribution.

a.title: Click to read more about: NEXT MEAL DISTRIBUTION: MONDAY, APRIL 20 [11am-2pm]

div.a: Read More about NEXT MEAL DISTRIBUTION: MONDAY, APRIL 20 [11am-2pm]

BOARDMAN WELCOMES NEW PARENT MENTOR

img.alt: Ariel jenkins student services parent mentor

span.p: Meet Ariel Jenkins--Boardman's new parent mentor. This is a new position in Boardman, funded by an Ohio Department of Education Grant, to assist families with children who have disabilities.

a.title: Click to read more about: BOARDMAN WELCOMES NEW PARENT MENTOR

div.a: Read More about BOARDMAN WELCOMES NEW PARENT MENTOR
KEEPING COMMUNICATION LINES OPEN

img.alt: communication graphic

span.b: In these unprecedented times, we are trying very hard to communicate with our entire Spartan Family. Just a few quick suggestions to get your questions and concerns answered as promptly as possible.

a.title: Click to read more about: KEEPING COMMUNICATION LINES OPEN

div.a: Read More about KEEPING COMMUNICATION LINES OPEN

strong.span: A group from Sunrise Senior Living visited Robinwood Elementary School in September, and joined in a gym class with kindergarten students. It was part of Sunrise's "Move 4 LIfe" campaign. Sunrise has 300 facilities across the nation, and on this day, each location had a group join in similar fun at schools across the country. Robinwood students were overjoyed to host them for a relay race.

img.alt: Senior citizens from sunrise Senior Living at the entrance of Robinwood Elementary
Loraine and a group of students share a snack after the relay races
